[å¥³]
Pictogram ( è±¡å½¢ ): a woman with breasts kneeling or standing. In the modern form, the pictogram is reversed from the Oracle Bone script form, and is "facing" toward the right edge of the character: the enclosed area (bounded on the right side by the downward-curving second stroke of the modern form) is the remnant of the figure's right breast, while the figure's left breast has disappeared.
Graphically cognate to æ¯ ( mÇ” , â€œmotherâ€) and æ¯‹ , which has developed similarly, but also includes dots for nipples and has retained both breasts. Compare Egyptian ğ“ .
Similar but unrelated to å© , in which the person kneeling has unspecified gender.

[æ±]
Phono-semantic compound ( å½¢è² / å½¢å£° , OC *njaÊ” ): semantic æ°´ ( â€œ river ; water â€ ) + phonetic å¥³ ( OC *naÊ”, *nas ) .
